title: The best baby monitors – including audio and video options
text:
Baby monitors allow you to keep tabs on your little one when you’re not in the same room. The question becomes how extensive you want those tabs to be, as the range of things that can be monitored keeps expanding.

For the safety conscious parent looking to buy a baby monitor, it’s easy to experience mission creep. At first you might be with your newborn all the time, so have no need for a monitor. At some point you find yourself out of easy earshot of your baby, chatting with friends or watching a film, and you realise that a monitor would be a useful thing to have. An audio monitor does the trick, you think, as all you need to know is whether or not your baby is awake and crying.

So you start searching for the best baby monitor on the market, and suddenly you’re looking at video monitors, which allow you to study your baby’s visual cues. Is your baby rubbing their eyes and likely to fall asleep again at any moment? Or is your baby crying because they’re uncomfortable and need rescuing? Now that you’ve started to consider video cameras, you find yourself asking: is a static camera good enough? What about when your baby rolls out of frame – wouldn’t it be great to pan the camera around to get a better view of their face? Or follow them around the room once they’re old enough to climb out of the cot.
description: Baby monitors allow you to keep tabs on your little one when you’re not in the same room.
